intro: Mentzelia paradoxensis, commonly known as the desert blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry conditions. Mentzelia paradoxensis is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its striking appearance and ecological importance in its native habitat.
